summary: This document is an email chain from June 25, 2019, between FBI personnel and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), coordinating victim notification procedures in anticipation of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest. It emphasizes the importance of having a complete victim list ready for the Victim Notification System (VNS) when charges are announced.

persons.name: Monroe
persons.context: Referred to as the case agent for the Epstein investigation; the email author states they will coordinate with Monroe to ensure victim information is ready for transfer.

connections.description: Both are FBI personnel coordinating on the Epstein case, with B. reaching out to Monroe regarding victim information.

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Arrest Victim Notification
events.description: Email chain discusses urgent preparations to ensure all identified victims are entered into the Victim Notification System (VNS) and that victim information is compiled and ready for transfer upon Epstein's arrest.

events.title: Upcoming Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The emails reference an imminent arrest of Jeffrey Epstein, with the SDNY planning a press release and an 800 number for victims to self-identify after the arrest.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the FBI were coordinating victim notification procedures in anticipation of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in June 2019.
There was an emphasis on having a complete victim list ready in the Victim Notification System (VNS) immediately upon arrest announcement to notify victims of their rights.
The SDNY planned to issue a press release and establish an 800 number for victims to self-identify and provide contact information after Epstein's arrest.
Specific instructions were given to include full names, addresses, and complete guardian information for minor victims in VNS entries to ensure proper notification.
The email chain indicates the case was considered 'higher profile' and required strict compliance with federal victim notification laws.
